actor_awards.notes: Best known for his role as the Scarecrow in The Wizard of Oz. He won a Tony Award for Best Actor in a Musical for Where's Charley? and received two stars on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

filmography.title: The Wizard of Oz
filmography.role_description: A Kansas farmhand and his Oz counterpart, a straw-stuffed scarecrow searching for a brain.
filmography.plot: Dorothy Gale is swept away from a farm in Kansas to a magical land of Oz in a tornado and embarks on a quest with her new friends to see the Wizard who can help her return home.

filmography.title: Babes in Toyland
filmography.role_description: The villainous, black-clad schemer who tries to ruin the wedding of Tom Piper and Mary Contrary.
filmography.plot: Mary Contrary is set to marry Tom Piper, but the evil Barnaby hires two goons to drown Tom and steal Mary's sheep.

filmography.title: Where's Charley?
filmography.role_description: An Oxford student who impersonates his own aunt to chaperone his romantic interests.
filmography.plot: An Oxford undergraduate poses as his rich widowed aunt from Brazil to act as a chaperone for two young ladies.

filmography.title: The Harvey Girls
filmography.role_description: A timid dancer who travels west and finds courage and romance.
filmography.plot: A group of mail-order waitresses head west to open a Harvey House restaurant and bring civilization to a rowdy town.

filmography.title: April in Paris
filmography.role_description: A bumbling State Department bureaucrat who mistakenly invites a chorus girl to a cultural festival in Paris.
filmography.plot: A bureaucrat mistakenly invites a chorus girl to represent the American theater at a prestigious exposition in Paris.

filmography.title: The Great Ziegfeld
filmography.role_description: Appears as himself, performing a signature dance number.
filmography.plot: The ups and downs of Florenz Ziegfeld Jr., the producer who became Broadway's biggest showman.

filmography.title: Sweethearts
filmography.role_description: A dancer who performs a wooden shoe number with Jeanette MacDonald.
filmography.plot: A husband-and-wife musical comedy team try to escape their demanding schedule and producer for a quiet life.

filmography.title: Rosalie
filmography.role_description: The friend and roommate of the West Point cadet protagonist.
filmography.plot: A cadet at West Point falls in love with a princess in disguise.

filmography.title: Look for the Silver Lining
filmography.role_description: A famous dancer and vaudevillian who becomes a mentor and partner to Marilyn Miller.
filmography.plot: A musical biography of Marilyn Miller, one of the brightest stars of Broadway musical comedy in the 1920s.

filmography.title: Four Jacks and a Jill
filmography.role_description: A bandleader who gets mixed up with a singer claiming to be royalty.
filmography.plot: Four musicians and a singer get involved with gangsters and a woman posing as a queen.

filmography.title: Sunny
filmography.role_description: A dancer and friend to the circus performer protagonist.
filmography.plot: A wealthy man falls in love with a circus performer, but her family disapproves.

filmography.title: Stage Door Canteen
filmography.role_description: Appears as himself, entertaining troops at the famous canteen.
filmography.plot: Several women work as hostesses at the Stage Door Canteen during WWII, where they meet and fall in love with soldiers.

filmography.title: The Daydreamer
filmography.role_description: A character in the live-action segments who interacts with the young Hans Christian Andersen.
filmography.plot: A young Hans Christian Andersen learns life lessons from the characters in the stories he will one day write.

filmography.title: Just You and Me, Kid
filmography.role_description: A friend of the main character, an ex-vaudevillian.
filmography.plot: An elderly ex-vaudevillian takes in a runaway teenager and protects her from drug dealers.

filmography.title: The Runner Stumbles
filmography.role_description: A church official who investigates a priest accused of murder.
filmography.plot: A priest is accused of murdering a nun with whom he had fallen in love.

filmography.title: The Entertainer
filmography.role_description: The aging father of a third-rate vaudeville performer. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: A vaudeville performer tries to keep his career alive while his personal life falls apart.
filmography.awards: Primetime Emmy: Nomination – Outstanding Single Performance by a Supporting Actor

filmography.title: Three on a Date
filmography.role_description: One of the winners on a dating show who goes on a trip to Hawaii. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: Four couples who won a dating game show go on a chaperone-supervised vacation to Hawaii.

filmography.title: That's Dancing!
filmography.role_description: One of the narrators of this documentary film about the history of dance in movies.
filmography.plot: A compilation of dance numbers from famous Hollywood musical films.

filmography.title: Heaven Only Knows
filmography.role_description: An angel who comes to Earth to help a family. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: An angel is sent to Earth to help a family save their restaurant business.

filmography.title: Captains and the Kings
filmography.role_description: A character in this miniseries about an Irish immigrant's rise to power. (TV Miniseries)
filmography.plot: An Irish immigrant arrives in America and builds a dynasty, facing tragedy and ambition.

filmography.title: The Little Sweep
filmography.role_description: The narrator of this TV movie based on Benjamin Britten's opera. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: A young chimney sweep is rescued by a group of children.
